CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 25, 1959, p. 1, reads: "Baby Fire Victims Buried - The caskets of three baby brothers, ages 1, 2, and 3, who died of smoke inhalation during a fire Friday at 29 Joseph St., are carried from the West Funeral Parlor by pallbearers. James Benford, Superintendent of Police James Slusser, several firemen and neighbors and occupants of the house fought vainly to try to bring the tots out of the fire alive. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Young pallbearers, including Boy Scouts, holding three caskets for brothers Vincent Jones, Charles Jones, and Norvelle Jones, victims of house fire, outside West's Funeral Home next to Lew's Loan Office, 2200 block Centre Avenue, Hill District
